title: South Korean Exchange Upbit Surpasses Coinbase, OKX in July Trading Volume to Take No. 2 Spot for First Time
description: The exchange bucked the general market trend that saw a decline in trading volume for most centralized exchanges.

title: Animoca Brands-Backed Game 'Wreck League' Puts Bored Apes Into the Storyline
description: The new game, launching in the next few weeks, will allow players to assemble giant robotic characters using collectible NFT parts.

title: SHIB Developers Aim to Leave Meme Coin Label Behind With New Identity Protocol Launch
description: Shiba Inu devs announced plans to tie digital identity services to all SHIB platform applications in a move to leave its meme coin status.

title: SEC Says Crypto Mining Firm Fraudulently Raised $50M in Cash, Bitcoin and Ethereum
description: Also known as DEBT Box, the crypto firm allegedly lied to investors, according to the SEC.

title: 'Wreck League' Mech Fighter Grows the 'Extended Yugaverse' With Bored Apes
description: Fighting game Wreck League will feature the Bored Ape Yacht Club and other Yuga Labs IP, with both NFT and "Web2" versions available.

title: Individual charged with money laundering admits to hacking Bitfinex in 2016: Report
description:
The identity of the hacker or hackers behind an exploit which removed more than 100,000 Bitcoin from Bitfinex in 2016 had only been the subject of speculation until Aug. 3.

One half of the couple alleged to have laundered billions of dollars worth of cryptocurrency has reportedly admitted he was behind the 2016 Bitfinex hack.

According to an Aug. 3 CNBC report, Ilya Lichtenstein told a U.S. court he was the individual behind an exploit of cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex in 2016 which resulted in the theft of roughly 119,754 Bitcoin (BTC). Lichtenstein spoke as part of a plea agreement with prosecutors, who charged him and his wife Heather Morgan with money laundering conspiracy and conspiracy to defraud the United States.

At the time of publication, it was unclear whether Morgan played any role in the Bitfinex hack. She is expected to appear before a judge on Aug. 3 as part of the same plea agreement in the money laundering case. Authorities arrested the pair in February 2022.

This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.

title: Bankrupt FTX seeks court approval to liquidate solvent Dubai subsidiary
description:
Bankrupt FTX wants the court to remove its Dubai subsidiary from the entities subject to U.S. bankruptcy proceedings, according to an Aug. 2 court filing. FTX revealed that its Dubai subsidiary, licensed as a virtual asset service provider in July of the prior year, had conducted no business in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). Further, […]

title: Huobi and AICoin Join Forces To Create an Efficient and Swift Digital Asset Trading Experience
description:
August 3, 2023 – Singapore, Singapore The globally leading digital asset trading platform Huobi has announced a profound collaboration with data service provider AICoin. The goal is to fully integrate API trading functionality and jointly build a more robust digital asset trading ecosystem, providing users with a convenient and efficient trading experience.
